Name: _______________Class: _______________GeometryMaster
Date: _______________Score: ___/100Grade 9-12

style: font-family: 'Spectral', serif; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; color: #2c3e50; margin-bottom: 5mm;
font-family: 'Spectral', serif; font-size: 18px; font-weight: 500; text-align: center; color: #5a6c7d; font-style: italic; margin-bottom: 8mm;

html: 1) Find the area of a circle with radius $r = 8$ cm. Use $\pi \approx 3.14$
2) A right triangle has legs of length 5 cm and 12 cm. Find the length of the hypotenuse using the Pythagorean theorem.
3) Calculate the volume of a rectangular prism with dimensions: length = 10 cm, width = 6 cm, height = 4 cm.

4) Find the area of a triangle with base $b = 15$ cm and height $h = 8$ cm.
Formula: $A = \frac{1}{2}bh$

5) A cylinder has radius $r = 4$ cm and height $h = 10$ cm. Find its volume.
Formula: $V = \pi r^2 h$
6) Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. If one angle measures $75°$, what is the measure of its corresponding angle?

7) Find the circumference of a circle with diameter $d = 14$ cm.
Formula: $C = \pi d$
8) In triangle ABC, if $\angle A = 60°$ and $\angle B = 80°$, find $\angle C$.
